title: Beef Stock
ingredients: 2 lbs shin of veal, on the bone
2 lbs shin of beef, sliced 1½-inches thick
instructions: Bone the veal and reserve the meat.
Place the veal bones, shortening, marrow bones, carrots, celery, onions, and garlic in a roasting pan.  Roast in the hot oven for 45 minutes, basting and turning occasionally.

Transfer the bones and vegetables to a large saucepan or stockpot, scraping any brown residue from the roasting pan.  Add the water, bay leaf, peppercorns, and thyme and bring to a boil.  Do not add any salt.
Skim and wipe the edge of the pan.  Partially cover and simmer for 4 hours.  Strain the stock and cool slightly.  (To here this is known as bone stock.)

For beef stock, skim 4 tablespoons of the fat from the surface of the bone stock and reserve.  Return the stock to the pan.  Brown the veal meat and the shin of beef in the reserved fat, turning occasionally, for about 10 minutes.  Pour the strained stock over the meat and bring to a boil.  Skim the surface and wipe the sides of the pan.  Lower the heat and partially cover.  Simmer for 3½ to 4 hours.  Strain and cool.  Remove the surface fat when ready to use.
Store in the refrigerator, boiling for 2 minutes every three days until it is used or freeze in an ice cube tray and store in freezer proof containers.
source: Harrods Cookery Book by Marilyn Aslani, Arbor House, New York, © 1985 by Marilyn Aslani and the National Magazine Co. Ltd.
